title: Curtis Pritchard goes casual after saying it's 'nice' not to spend every day with Maura Higgins
text:
His relationship with Maura Higgins has been going from strength to strength since leaving the Love Island villa.

And Curtis Pritchard has revealed he's enjoying a 'normal relationship' with the Irish beauty, 28, where they don't see each other everyday after a summer together 24/7.

The loved-up dancing pro, 23, cut a casual figure in a leather jacket and tracksuit bottoms as he arrived in Manchester on Monday after a glam night in London.

Casual: Curtis Pritchard, 23, cut a casual figure in a leather jacket and tracksuit bottoms as he arrived in Manchester on Monday after a glam night in London where he revealed it was 'nice in a weird way' not to spend every day with girlfriend Maura Higgins after leaving Love Island

Curtis had spent the night before at the Pride Of Britain Awards but appeared unaffected by the late night as he sipped on a hot drink at Piccadilly train station.

He looked relaxed in a striped t-shirt, black trainers with a white sole and a cap with a pair of earphones around his neck.

The reality TV star's appearance comes after he spoke about his relationship with Maura and making things work despite their hectic schedules.

Curtis told MailOnline: 'We’ve created a normal relationship where we go to work and we miss each other so it’s really nice when we come back and see each other.

Relaxed: The reality TV star looked chilled as he donned a brown leather jacket and carried a hot drink and a snack after arriving at Manchester Piccadilly station

'We don’t get to spend every day together but it’s nice in a weird way... people come out of Love Island and spend 24 hours a day together and it becomes a bit much.'

Curtis added that by not being together every day it means they really value seeing each other when they get the chance.

He said: 'I allow her to do all the work that she’s doing and she allows me, so that gives us space. When we see each other we really want to spend time together.'

On the go: Curtis appeared unaffected by the late night on Monday as he sipped on his drink

He also revealed the couple aren't letting themselves be pressured by anyone else and are taking things at their own pace.

'We're just not letting anybody else influence it - when we came out [of the villa] everyone said "you got to make it official why aren’t you posting things,"

'But it’s our relationship we’re going to chill out and take it easy we’ve only known each other for three and a half months,' Curtis said.

Dapper: The star looked sharp on Monday night as he attended the Pride of Britain Awards and spoke about his relationship with Maura, saying they don't see each other every day

As for the rest of the year, it looks like the dancing pro won't be spending Christmas with Maura, as their busy schedules clash, and she's in training for Dancing On Ice.

He said: 'I think Maura’s going back home to Ireland and I’m gonna be doing two shows a day [in pantomime Dick Whittington] so I’ll be too busy.

'Our schedules change day by day so we try and plan but it’s hard. There’s so many opportunities. I want to support her all the way. If I don’t see her for a month it’s hard but I’m fine with that.'

Curtis was also full of praise for Maura's developing ice skating skills, saying: 'I’ve been and watched her a couple of times.

Joking around: Curtis and his Strictly Come Dancing star brother AJ, 24, appeared in good spirits as they walked the red carpet on Monday night

'I saw a video of her from day one such a big improvement she’s doing fantastic. I hope she wins it. I haven’t seen the others I can’t say yes or no.'

And although his dancing terrain is rather different to Maura's, Curtis said he will 'absolutely' give her some tips.

He said: 'I dance on a floor so it’s quite grippy but I’ll absolutely help her from here up [the top half] once she gets the technique and the basic before putting the icing on the cake.'

Earlier this month Curtis and Maura, who have been dating since their stint on this year's Love Island, made their relationship official.

Love: Maura and Curtis finally made their romance official three months after leaving the villa and are now boyfriend and girlfriend

Curtis whisked Maura away on a romantic weekend and then asked her to be his girlfriend over dinner.

Maura told OK! magazine: 'He asked and I said yes obviously. He took me away for a weekend break, and he asked me out over dinner in London the next day.'

When asked why it took the couple longer than most to make their relationship official, Curtis insisted he didn't want them to rush into things too quickly.

He said: 'I want something that's going to last forever. There's no point in rushing things. We've only known each other a short amount of time.'
description: Curtis Pritchard, 23, and Maura Higgins, 28, spent the summer together on Love Island but he has said it's 'nice in a weird way' to not spend every day with each other now.
